label: Description
value: Left, incomplete, side elevation; right, front elevation. The shaft is attached to, and arises from, a convex panel. The shaft itself, consisting of rocaille motifs, and of a dragon supports a scaffolding with two candles.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Candelabrum with two lateral framing growths.  The central stem consists of a calyx section, a base with crouching lions flanking an ovoidal medallion, an urn, a thyrsus.  Framing strip.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, pencil on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Gaine with the bust of Dionysus supporting a bowl full of bunches of grapes and leaves from which a faun with a thyrsus and two acanthus scrolls rise.  A disk with roses and a trophy are suspended from the scroll at right.  A flower basket standing upon the head of the half-figure of a lion, below.  The left half shows the half-figure of a lion supporting a flower basket over which a thyrsus rises and to which a trophy of pastoral musical instruments is fastened.  Framing strip.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash on paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Fountain consisting of a pedestal of two dolphins and a mask which support the basin in which water flows.  A shell rises from behind the basin obliquely to the entablature of the niche forming an opening in the wall at the top.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Elevation of a wall of a vestibule

label: Description
value: A central arch flanked by engaged, fluted Ionic columns and two wall panels. Inside the arch stands the figure of a woman on a pedestal. She supports a fruit bowl with candles on her head and hands. The height of the wall is given as "16 pied 50."

label: Physical description
value: Pen and Chinese ink, brush and light brown watercolor wash, graphite on paper

value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for the Elevation of the Entrance Wall of a Salon

label: Description
value: A wall panel with a looking glass is flanked by panels with panoplies and folding doors. Another wall panel is beside the right door. It is decorated with an arabesque, in which doves are billing before the foot of a burning lamp.

label: Description
value: A vase shape with two handles standing on a pedestal.  Two of the three intended arms are shown emerging from the vase.  Ram's heads are applied near their upper ends from which festoons hand toward spirals.  A pole which is decorated with flowers rises on top  Framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, on paper.

label: Credit line

label: Description
value: From a vase standing on top of a shaft emerge two acanthus rinceaux holding sockets with low burning candles and a caduceus. Framing lines. Margins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink with ink washes on paper

label: Provenance
value: Jean Léon Decloux; 1908; Acquired by Museum from the Advisory Council

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Two busts of Egyptian women serve as handles of a case from which three twisted cords emerge. Two are curved laterally and hold acanthus spirals which support two sockets. The central one rises straight and carries a socket. The sockets are split at the top edges; fires rise from them. Pearl chains connect the vegetable motifs. Framing lines. Margins.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and wash, on paper
